title: Understanding the Equilibrium Constant
text: The equilibrium constant expression is a ratio of the concentrations of products to reactants, each raised to the power of their coefficients in the balanced equation.

title: Identifying Products and Reactants
text: In the reaction 2SO2(g)+O2(g)<->2SO3(g), identify which species are products and which are reactants.

title: Using Coefficients as Exponents
text: Remember that the coefficients in the balanced equation become the exponents in the equilibrium constant expression. For example, the coefficient of SO3 is $$2$$, so it will be raised to the power of $$2$$.

title: Writing the Expression for Products
text: For the product side, write the concentration of SO3 raised to the power of its coefficient.

title: Writing the Expression for Reactants
text: For the reactant side, write the concentration of SO2 raised to the power of its coefficient and multiply it by the concentration of O2 raised to the power of its coefficient.
